values.description: The context will be inherited from the parent thread.
A new task decorator will be assigned for each request and the context will be copied to the new async child thread.

properties.name: app.api-base-path
properties.description: Default prefix used by all RESTs.

properties.name: springdoc.enabled
properties.description: It defines if Open API (formally Swagger API) will be enabled or not.

properties.name: springdoc.package-to-scan
properties.description: Package that will be scanned to retrieve all endpoints to be exposed.

properties.name: springdoc.paths-to-expose
properties.description: Only the paths defined here will be exposed on Swagger UI.

properties.name: spring.graphql.aliased-scalars
properties.description: It defines the aliased scalars which will be used by the application.

properties.name: spring.graphql.extended-scalars
properties.description: It specifies the extended scalars for graphql-java which will be used by the application.

properties.name: spring.mvc.async.context-propagation-mode
properties.description: It defines how to propagate the request and locale context to asynchronous children threads. The default value is 'NON_INHERITABLE'.

properties.name: spring.web.cors.allowed-methods
properties.description: Set the HTTP methods to allow, e.g. GET, POST, etc. The special value '*' allows all methods.

properties.name: spring.web.cors.allowed-headers
properties.description: Set the list of headers that a preflight request can list as allowed for use during an actual request. The special value '*', may be used to allow all headers. By default all headers are allowed.

properties.name: spring.web.cors.allowed-origins
properties.description: The list of allowed origins that be specific origins, e.g. 'https://domain1.com', or '*' for all origins. By default, all origins are allowed.

properties.name: spring.web.cors.exposed-headers
properties.description: Set the list of response headers other than 'simple', headers, i.e. Cache-Control, Content-Language, Content-Type, Expires, Last-Modified, or Pragma, that an actual response might have and can be exposed. Note that '*' is not supported on this property.

properties.name: spring.web.exception-handler.should-log-as-warning
properties.description: Exceptions list which should be recorded in the log as a warning.

properties.name: spring.web.client.rest-template.enabled
properties.description: It defines if a default client will be created to access another service via RESTful API.

properties.name: spring.web.client.rest-template.base-path
properties.description: Specify the RESTful API base path, that will be accessed.
